titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm Microfilm As-Broadcast Scripts, 1928-1958 RL.00655
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Richard Collier; machine-readable finding aid created by: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-12 13:30:51 -0400.

change.item: Converted from dtd to schema, transformed with AT-import-fixer.xsl, and imported to Archivists Toolkit

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm Microfilm As-Broadcast Scripts
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) 16mm Microfilm As-Broadcast Scripts span the years 1928-1958 and contain transcripts of radio and television dramas and variety shows, news programs, commercials, and sports programming. Companies featured include Andrew Jergens, Ballantine, Brillo, Ciba-Geigy, Fannie Farmer, Ford, General Cigar, J.B. Williams, Kodak, Kraft, Lamont-Corliss (Pond's), the New York Yankees, Penick & Ford (Br'er Rabbit), Standard Brands, the U.S. Marine Corps, and Wrigley. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm Microfilm As-Broadcast Scripts, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. 16mm Microfilm As-Broadcast Scripts were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1987.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) 16mm Microfilm As-Broadcast Scripts span the years 1928-1958 and contain transcripts of radio and television dramas and variety shows, news programs, commercials, and sports programming. Companies featured include Andrew Jergens, Ballantine, Brillo, Ciba-Geigy, Fannie Farmer, Ford, General Cigar, J.B. Williams, Kodak, Kraft, Lamont-Corliss (Pond's), the New York Yankees, Penick & Ford (Br'er Rabbit), Standard Brands, the U.S. Marine Corps, and Wrigley.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by reel number, and physical sequence of the scripts therein. Original documents were microfilmed in no order, so scripts relating to a particular client or program are scattered throughout the collection. The collection described here represents a portion of the whole 16mm microfilm collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in other collections of the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives:
